intro: Haplanthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false hawthorn, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree characterized by its opposite, simple, and usually lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in the spring. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Haplanthoides is native to parts of the southeastern United States and is adapted to a variety of soil types.
